website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for something more protective for travel, consider this carry-on sized hard case from Pelican. It's a favorite among all types who use mobile lenses.
pros: Polyurethane wheels with stainless steel bearings.Molded top and side handles
Stainless steel hardware and padlock protectors
cons: Latches are temperamental and can come undone at unexpected times

customer_reviews.title: It's a Pelican, Quality is what they make.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Pelican, company speaks for itself in terms of quality, they are the best. Case arrived fast and is perfect. The case meets TSA regulations for a carry on, and because of how tough the cases are they can be sit on if needed or used to defend yourself if you booked a flight with United Air Lines and they try to drag you off the flight that you paid for. Great Case all around.
customer_reviews.author: Atheos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my last Pelican 1510, which the ham fisted morons at Delta Airlines tried to destroy by forcibly prying it open in direct violation of federal law. Luckily, the case was so tough, that in spite of their attempts to gain entry, they were unsuccessful in prying it open. When they were called on their lawlessness, they paid for a new one so I wouldn't cause any trouble for the damage they did to the case. That legendary ruggedness is exactly why I chose to replace it with the exact same thing, and this new one lives up to that reputation quite well. You cannot buy a tougher case for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Don Zappone

customer_reviews.title: Carry on my wayward son..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a carry on for short trips. It fits three days of cloths, toiletries, and my iPad pro with charger. That is about the maximum I could fit though. I am not going to use the foam but to order the one without foam the shipping time was crazy long. My job uses Pelican cases for protecting our expensive tools, so I know they are superior for durability and protection. All in all I think this will make a great piece of luggage for a long weekend or a short business trip.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Good roll aboard
customer_reviews.text: Good roll aboard, fits in all the over heads I have used so far. I am not sure it would work in a small regional jet, or something like that. Would give it five stars if it didn't have the hard plastic wheels. I replaced mine with small roller blade wheels. Much better. Otherwise a good piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: John Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best peice of kit I own.
customer_reviews.text: Carries my GH5, GX85, Canon 6D, GoPro Hero 5, x5 Lenses, x2 Lens Hoods, Charging Cables, x6 Lens Filters, Ipad Mini 3, SD card-pack, x3 step up rings, x3 gear rings, camera blower with mini cleaning cloth/solution... I live in Tampa FL where it rains every other day... Snaps shut hard & keeps the rain out. I replaced the wheels with rollerblade wheels so it doesn't vibrate the heck out of my equipment when using the arm to pull it behind me and I use zip-ties on the lock-holes when carrying by handle to ensure no clasping mistakes (which can happen with any case with clasps).
customer_reviews.author: Laura kish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to strap my gear to my ATV for a week touring the Ozarks. River and stream crossings can get dicey, thought it would be best to make sure my gear stays dry and doesn't get bounced around. I'm really happy I went with the foam pick and pluck. Everything is nice and snug and well padded. I considered going the more expensive routes with the Trek manager package to keep things simpler, but plucking the foam was simple and quick. Really happy with how much I was able to store in this carry on case.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This makes for some easy feedback, as Pelican cases have always (at least ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes for some easy feedback, as Pelican cases have always (at least in our experience) lived up to their hype. We sometimes get other brands who send in a case or two to try to thwart our balance of opinion with---but so far, Pelican seems to be one of the only cases that feel right, look right, perform right, and still counts for the majority of what we use. Also, this specific case is great for your carry on. Assuming at least that you keep an eye on your weight. You may want to buy a scale because it's quite easy to get carried away (see my pun?).
customer_reviews.author: Poc Network // Tech

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: have been using it as a carry on luggage. i know pelican makes great cases. the lid organizer is a good addition to the case. because it is a popular size, there are a few options for accessories and attachments for it. i have a peace of mind when it is checked in on flights and gets thrown around. its been reliable just like their other cases.
customer_reviews.author: biggbuddha

customer_reviews.title: Seriously awesome
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT and Telecom, and I keep all my tools in here. It's the perfect size and more durable than a 70s Mercedez. The TSA and baggage handlers have tried their worst with this, obvious from the nicks and gouges on the corners. Despite their rough handling though, it's solid. Sometimes I use it as a stool, and sometimes as a step. It does not care. I'm considering a second for the rest of my travel needs.
customer_reviews.author: A A Ron

customer_reviews.title: Wow. I'm not sure who do me more dissapointed in: the air line or Pelican.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about 5 times to fly in 5 years. I noticed the crack on the edge and thought surely Pelican stands behind their products. The warranty is only good for THREE YEARS? These things are supposed to be tough, durable, and crush proof. Maybe the less expensive products are even better than this. I guess I'm looking somewhere else. Since the crack holds the seal in place, it is no longer water tight. Into the trash you go! And no more Pelican products.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Complies with Airlines Overhead Bag Size Limitations.
customer_reviews.text: The container is smaller than I wanted since I wanted to include other tools in addition to the scope. (Curse those Airline Overhead baggage size limitations!!!) For an expensive oscilloscope the depth was the right size and you have to dedicated the packaging to immobilize the scope. Cutting out the padding was easy and the scope fits snuggly yet is easy to get out. There are two layers of foam so you may have to remove the top layer to access the scope handle to get it out. It is a very sturdy case for airport travel and should protect the hardware from mishandling and falls.
customer_reviews.author: PJC

customer_reviews.title: A tough case unlike any other! Has one con!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built hard case for your dslr and lenses and whatever else you may have! It holds my two dslr bodies, 4 lenses, 2 flashes, and room for extra accessories in te left over pockets. I also bought the netted pockets that screws in the inside lid of the case and that holds all of the smaller accessories you may have. Check out the photos below! My only problem with the case is that the oull out handle is really flimsly and I cant stand it being that lose while pulling a fully loaded cases. It feels like it will snap off.
customer_reviews.author: kuriouskoala

customer_reviews.title: Travel and Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've used this as a suitcase all over the country and also to travel with Camera gear using the included padded dividers and I have never had anything go wrong with this case. for travel it is a bit heavy at around 12 lbs dead empty but the ability to padlock it makes it superb for carrying firearms during airline travel and for expensive equipment that needs to be watertight and extremely shock resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Best travel choice protecting equipment
customer_reviews.text: I take this everywhere with my camera equipment in it. It is sturdy, watertight, and holds more then it looks like it will. It keeps everything in place so it doesnt get damaged during transit and it is easy to wheel around and use. I like this so much, that I bought 2 of them to use for all of my professional camera equipment. I chose this size because it fits on all airlines as a carry on case.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: No issues on any airline foreign or Domestic
customer_reviews.text: My main concern when I bought this was whether I'd have any issues on the airlines. No issues on domestic airlines. I didn't even get asked about it. When I was overseas, Southeast Asia (Ana Airlines, Cebu Pacific), I didn't have any issues. It fits in most of the overhead compartments like any other carry-on, but on some smaller aircraft you'll need to put it in the overhead in the horizontal position.
customer_reviews.author: Justin E.

customer_reviews.title: Oh my
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend that much on a cube of plastic, but dang was it worth it. This thing is wonderfully made. It's solid as a rock on the outside and soft as pillow inside. I love the water tightness being on photo shoots with all my gear in it. I'm also tall and it's hard to get a rolling case with a handle that is easy to pull along... this one is awesome and travels a lot on those wheels. I expect the price is partly because it seems like it will outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: O. Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Great way to protect important gear.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product if you have important equipment carry around. I used this on a trip to Boston and it was a dream to be able to put it in overhead storage and not have any issues with the airline saying it was too big. It also has taken quite a beating and is Still in great condition. The pick and pluck Foam is a little annoying but you can purchase different liners if it’s too much of an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: DJE87

customer_reviews.title: Good case but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: For the last 1.5 years I have used the Pelican 1510 for traveling with my tools and until now it has held up to the wear and tear that comes along with checked baggage, however on my last trip the plastic connection for the retractable handle broke. Unfortunately it cannot be fixed and the case must be replaced. The warranty department at Pelican is processing it but it is taking longer than expected which is frustrating, especially when I travel weekly with tools. It would be nice if the connection were made out of a more durable material to prevent this from happening. Fingers crossed it doesn’t happen again with the new case...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Photographers beware
customer_reviews.text: I shoot with a Nikon D800 and have the following Nikkor lens: 28 - 300, 24 - 70, 14- 24, and a 200 - 500. The average height is around 6.5 inches except for the 500. I knew I would have to lay the 500 down but expected to stand the other lens up to accommodate everything in the case for my trip. The two foam inserts stacked on top of each other is 5 1/4 inches tall. After making a mess cutting the foam and dealing with static, I threw the foam away and placed an order for the dividers instead. I hope this will solve my problem. The case itself is definitely quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Protect your gear with Pelican
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Pelican case this size. I've had my first one for over three years and it is a rugged as they come. I used these cases in the Army, so I knew of their reliability, strength, and toughness. When I needed to add more photography gear, I wanted it protected so Pelican was the way to go. Don't skimp on protecting your valuable equipment!!
customer_reviews.author: E. T.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Biggest carry-on size!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, always wanted a pelican carry case because of durability and warranty! We took it on our month long trip to Peru and it handled all of our YouTube gear, Canon 6D MkII with EF 24-105L F4 lens, 2 go-pros, 3 Mophie battery packs, gorilla pod, and associated cables for each plus batteries for the Canon camera. Absolutely worth the money. Comes with the pluck and pearl foam inserts which if you need to run different items can purchase another set for different setups if needed. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great Case/Mostly Airline Approved
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Pelican! I use this for camera equipment. The pick and pluck makes customizing the case quite simple, however, I also needed to cut out some areas to make them more rounded. This is airline approved for carryon, however, I have found on some smaller planes that Delta flies they are not able to fit under the seat. They are fine down to the CRJ 900. Anything under that (like a CRJ 200) and they have to turn sideways, so the person next you you has to be cooperative, and you have to battle the flight attendants who will want you to put it under the plane. I will not do that with a $20K camera!
customer_reviews.author: coolbowtie

customer_reviews.title: Best versatile case for your equipment!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've been using high quality backpacks to store my gear but I never felt comfortable as a long term solution. Got this case to add more protection to my gear. Very solid build! Plus I also need something versatile and small enough that I could keep with me when traveling. This is the perfect case for my needs. I fit two GH5 camera bodies. A 70-200mm Olympus lens, 24-105mm Canon, 18-35mm Sigma, 15mm Lumix, 7.5mm OOWA, 45mm Lumix lens, plus Room for my Mavic 2 pro. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reason4Truth

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and durable - highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rolling case - also is carry-on size for flights. We use this at work for transporting audio equipment - our company has about 30 of these. Found them to be rugged and durable. They are also waterproof and airtight, so if you store things, there won't be moisture. Never hurts to throw in some silica gel packets. I finally bought one for personal use and expect it to function like the ones at work. I opted for the padded dividers as I'll be carrying various electronics. If you are carrying high-end electronic items, I recommend the foam so that you can tailor the foam to your item for super added protection. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sunmist2015

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't get banged up
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my photography equipment. I live in a tropical environment where it is ALWAYS raining. There is NO MOISTURE in my case. I have taken my case on trips- fits nicely in the overhead compartment on planes. I have even dropped the case getting it down from the overhead- no damage whatsoever to the outside or the contents of the case.I recommend highly and will be purchasing another for my husband (he is starting to eye mine...)
customer_reviews.author: J. Brison

customer_reviews.title: Great Case! Loudy Latches!
customer_reviews.text: The latches pop off all the time and the two times I have checked this case it arrived with the latches open and my stuff spread out all over the luggage carousel. I lost my Sonicare toothbrush last time. I got locks for it this time and they will probably fix this, but who knows. Still, the latches shouldn't pop open this easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: The Classic Travel Pelican
customer_reviews.text: The classic rolling Pelican case is classic for a reason. The case works beautifully, handles daily wear and tear just fine, and comes with Pelican's reputation for quality builds and customer support. The 1510 is far easier to pull than most rolling tool cases and fits far more easily in many places. The clearance from the ground is not optimal, and the rigid plastic shell does produce a booming rumble when rolled over pavement and other rough surfaces, however these are far from notable problems. Despite being lower to the ground than a common rolling suitcase, the caster handle most surfaces well, and the case is small enough (with large, comfortable handles) to easily be lifted over obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: RedBassett

customer_reviews.title: case is great, i bought the one with padded dividers and ...
customer_reviews.text: case is great, i bought the one with padded dividers and storage lid. You need to dump the foam on top if you use the storage lid though. It isn't a very large case, you cant fit a 70-200 with body attached along the width of it. I can only store them separately. I am able to fit 2 5d bodies, 70-200, and 4 other lenses, 580ex, charger, and some hoods. I wish i got the 1600 series which is a little bigger since i wont be using on an airplane, but this one was on sale for 150 with dividers so i jumped on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent P

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments Ive made in my career (aside from all ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments Ive made in my career (aside from all of the tools it holds). This case organizes and protects all my neccesary gear in transit and through the manufacturer I have a lifetime warranty on anything that might break. There are cheaper cases that Ive seen peers buy, but the sides flex the lids dont seal, and all around the cheaper offerings from competitors... well just feel cheaper. For a product that is built to last a lifetime (and the service to support that) might as well spend a few extra bucks to get something you will appreciate using.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L.

customer_reviews.title: Strong well-made case
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strong well-made case. I find it works well as an airplane carry on to protect my laptop computer and camera equipment. I upgraded the original hard wheels with these slightly larger wheels which roll smoother and quieter:
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I purchased a canon 5d4 a couple months back, I really wanted to provide it and my other gear some protection. Gear: Canon 5dX XX-XXX f4 l lens XX-XXX f2.8l is lens 24-70 f4l lens 17-40 f4l lens 2 580ex speedlites Some random cables All fit comfortably, I am thrilled with my initial impression of the sturdiness of the case, the smugness of the foam to my equipment and that I should be able to travel with my equipment and not have to worry about it getting dirty, damaged or lost. Wonderful purchase. Got it for 105 on a black Friday sale.
customer_reviews.author: richl

customer_reviews.title: The device has a build quality superior to the cheaper cases I have been using
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these for several months, especially to consolidate all the camera equipment into one case. The Pelican quality goes without saying. The device has a build quality superior to the cheaper cases I have been using. The extendable handle and wheels will make it very convenient when traveling through an airport. There is enough room in this to accommodate 3 DSLR cameras and 7 various lenses, plus the optional snap in top accessory cover provides room for battery chargers, SD cards, extra batteries etc. Without question highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: They are just awesome, and I think everybody should know
customer_reviews.text: It's a badass case, and it does exactly what you'd expect. Keeps your valuables safe. This company delivers, and its' products are worth the money. No, I don't work for or profit in anyway from Pelican. They are just awesome, and I think everybody should know. Floating waterproof case? Check Airline altitude pressure worries? Taken care of. Wheels? Hell yeah and a telescoping handle too. Fell off the truck? Whatever it'll be fine. Good enough for the Military, good enough for me. Plus this is the biggest size for carry on. It's not huge, but it'll hold the most important stuff. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Matt R.

customer_reviews.title: They're industry leaders for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Pelican cases just can't be beat. There is a reason seriousl professionals use them. I've used cases of all sizes to get broadcast equipment all across the country, and without exception everything arrives safely. I ordered this case for my DSLR equipment. Nicely holds my Canon 7D ii body, 4 lenses 2 flash units as well as spare batteries and charger, with space left over. Can't go wrong with these cases.
customer_reviews.author: News Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for film equipment
customer_reviews.text: I work in audio/video for a large corporation and needed to ship mini film kits to various offices around the US to film small events and training sessions. I bought three and these cases have lasted through several shipments with no damage to my equipment. The pick and pluck foam takes time to customize, but I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect equipment travel case!
customer_reviews.text: Already been on 20 planes and in 5 different states! Carried about 3K worth of tools. Perfect size! I would highly recommend getting a TSA lock for both latches though. The first time I flew, I picked it up at baggage claim and one of the latches were unlocked! Luckily nothing was missing but now I place two TSA locks while flying.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby W.

customer_reviews.title: No small wonder the Pelican 1510 is rated so highly!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with 2 day Prime shipping. Opened it up, played with it, and am incredibly satisfied. Foam will simply be pulled and will put new lid organizer in with heavy duty Velcro for simple travel via airlines - otherwise, it will be used as our Ham communications "go box" - (wheels are a good thing when you are in the over 70 for lunch bunch). I am fairly tall, so did order a Nylon Luggage Handle Extender elsewhere to ease bending my back getting to car rental, (and back for return check-in). The 1510 is perfect for my wife's stature "as is".
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Stites

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely, positively the best!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case for traveling as it easily stands up to the gorillas at the airports. It’s not the lightest but it is the sturdiest. This IS the best bang for the buck! It's foam interior is infinitely adjustable and protects my tools from banging around during flight. The wheels are great too and mostly protected so they won’t get broken.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect setup for my camera gear!
customer_reviews.text: I carry two canon camera bodies, 4 lenses (100mm macro, 15-135mm, 10-22mm and a 100-400mm) plus the battery chargers for both cameras and a sleeve with SD cards in this case. It's compact but doesn't feel crowded. Haven't flown with it yet but first impressions are this case will be perfect for carry-on luggage for a flight. I like how I can lock it with regular padlocks for added security.
customer_reviews.author: John T. McClanaghan

customer_reviews.title: small and well built
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a carry on. I did not want it for camera gear, but rather clothing. If you pack it correctly, you can get a few pairs of jeans, shirts, socks - the basics. It's great for 3-5 days of travel. Unless you have really small clothes, don't expect to make this work for a 7 day trip. I've used it a few times and I've had compliments while traveling each time. On 5 day trips, I'll have to pack a backpack for shoes/etc - and just put my clothes in here. VERY well built like all Pelican products. It will last a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: I_FearNoEvil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and great value for a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the recommendation of a professional photographer. I am glad I did...this is one high quality case and has traveled with me to some pretty rugged photo shoots. The adjustable foam inserts are great. I purchase an accessory bag net that installed in the lid...this added an even better functionality to an already great product. As I have grown my lens collection, this case is keeping that investment safe. Pelican did an awesome job in designing a product that a very mobile photographer can use and travel with safely. Excellent design and great value for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: f lapierre

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is my travel case or when I need some gear at an onsite shoot. It holds alot of stuff. Wheels are good. Embedded handle is ok, not great. Secure snaps and you can put a real padlock on this thing. If you have any equipment with serials numbers you should always record those serials numbers before traveling. And I put stickers on the outside of this case both for 'Fragile' and 'All Serial Numbers Recorded'. Fits into most carry on overhead bins (except for puddle jumpers or region jets).
customer_reviews.author: inayat2012 on youtube

customer_reviews.title: Protecting Medicine on a Boat
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to house my Mavic Drone, which it did fine, however now it is allowing a doctor in a third world country to ferry medicine across on choppy waters, in a small boat. Has 60 lbs of flotation, which is perfect for what it is being used for. I can't imagine anyone making a tougher case.
customer_reviews.author: WanderingFather

customer_reviews.title: Safe Storehouse and workhorse for camera gear.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent safe case for your camera gear or any light electronic gear for that matter. It won't be your only camera case, but it'll be your safe storehouse and workhorse. Keep a small lightweight carry bag for shoots where you won't need access to all your gear. But this as a base and travel case - can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Jeffrey S Forrester

customer_reviews.title: but I'm glad I chose Pelican over the Amazon brand
customer_reviews.text: No offense to Amazon, but I'm glad I chose Pelican over the Amazon brand. Slightly more money, but I know I got the best quality for my purposes. Strong and reinforced pad eyes for pad locks. I'm a technician that needs to carry a few laptops and tablets and other equipment as a carry on for flights and the Pelican 1510 is unmatched in quality and durability. I'm sure I'll get a decade or so of hard use out this case, unless of course it gets stolen which is a constant concern...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Photographers dream
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect case for photographers. I’m able to place three cameras (one disassembled), flashes, extra lens, extra accessories perfectly. This is a great size. It’s heavier than the pelican air line, but this one fits more. Definitely recommend the lid accessory bag. I no longer have to carry multiple bags.
customer_reviews.author: JulesyJul

customer_reviews.title: The Nanuk case seems better
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the design and build of the similarly-sized Nanuk (935) case. The fit/finish are comparable, but I'll buy the Nanuk again, not the Pelican, particularly when cost is considered. Will revise the review If longevity turns out to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: non_compos_mentis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect photography carry on
customer_reviews.text: This case is great because it's the maximum size for airplane carry on. There are 3rd party vendors that sell custom padded interiors for this model too, so that's really handy. I'm a videographer and use this to transport thousands of dollars worth of fragile video cameras and lenses. I use the Portabrace padded interior which happens to be manufactured in Bennington, Vermont so I supported a local manufacturer. Highly recommended for photographers or anyone who travels and needs bullet proof (literally) protection.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rose

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank. Perfect size for carry-on air travel (if weight is not a concern)
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank. Great padding. Perfect size for carry-on air travel (if weight is not a concern). The only small disappointment is the fact that it doesn't hold as much gear as I was expecting. This is due to the space taken by the thick plastic casing and wheels. In order to fit all my gear (2 Canon 6Ds, 4 lenses, batteries, charger, etc.) I need to remove the lenses from the bodies and store them vertically. Not a big deal, but certainly removing lenses does increase the risk of dust on the sensor. On the other hand, nothing else would protect my gear as this Pelican product.
customer_reviews.author: Michel B. (Toronto)

customer_reviews.title: J. Meyer Photos, LLC
customer_reviews.text: Black Friday deal for only $107!! Professional-quality case. This thing is a tank. Holds: 2 bodies- Nikon D500 & Nikon D7100 4 Lens- Nikkor 18-200mm, Nikkor 35-70mm, Tokina 11-16mm, Tokina 100mm Lee Big Stopper & adapter 2 EN-EL15 batteries 1 MH-25 quick charger Recently ordered the lid organizer off ebay for only $23! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO much room!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible case. When I first received it, I was worried by the size. However, once I had mapped it out and started plucking the foam, I could not believe the amount of room that was available. For reference, I was able to fit a Canon 60D body, five lenses, two external flashes, a flash soft box, a GoPro, two battery chargers, four lens filters, and other miscellaneous items with enough room for another lens (wishful thinking). All of this in an extremely sturdy container that I can easily fly with...consider me a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: This specific one also allow me to have a pocket to fit my Macbook in as well which is perfect. If you are an avid photography a
customer_reviews.text: I cant wait to use this case. I bought this case for two reasons. I needed a heavy duty case to carry all my camera equipment when I travel and because it fits the carry on dimensions perfectly. This case fits quite a bit. I have an a7ii, three lenses, battery grip, a couple other accessories along with an as200v and at least ten accessories. This specific one also allow me to have a pocket to fit my Macbook in as well which is perfect. If you are an avid photography and need a case. I definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: r.j. Skalet

customer_reviews.title: Industry standard for tough and portable case, that meets the Carry-On size requirement!
customer_reviews.text: Industry standard for tough and portable case, that meets the Carry-On size requirement! Pelican has built its name on being the brand of choice for moving valuable equipment, through having the toughest cases with a pressurizing valve that is still in a portable form factor size. I have worked with many companies moving very expensive medical equipment and Pelican was the one brand that fully protected the equipment. Though it is a little heavy , it is well worth it to fully protect your valuable items- do not hesitate to buy this tough case!
customer_reviews.author: EntrepreneuR

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is impeccable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to store my video camera audio recording equipment. I needed a case that was durable, weather proof, padded and able to be used as a carry on for the airlines. This far it has worked great and will be getting at least on or two more for my photography equipment. the dividers worked well and were easily adjustable. Build quality is impeccable. The suitcase style handle extends and the wheels make it a breeze to pull around when loaded. The only con I can give this is the amount of noise the latches create when latching or unlatching. If you are going on a "quiet" project, be sure to open the case latches before the even starts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: ... for years carried my camera and gear in a nice photography backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have for years carried my camera and gear in a nice photography backpack. As I've upgraded lenses and added this and that, the bag has increasingly gotten heavier and the shoulder strain has increased. I bought this for an upcoming India trip after carefully researching the market. This case is tough-as-nails. It's perfect for overhead storage, and comes with wheels so that weight is not an issue. Internally it can be designed to your individual taste and specs. My laptop conveniently fits on top, and closing it is like closing a sealed vault--the sturdiest case I've seen. I'm totally won over. It's Pelican from now on.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nathanael Gough

customer_reviews.title: Well...it’s hard to rate.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great but I haven’t put it to full use yet. I can definitely say it’s perfect for storage. It’s big but you can put it anywhere. Comes with the equipment needed to cut spaces etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size Carry-On with plenty of protection for sensitive electronics
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size Carry-On with plenty of protection for sensitive electronics. Interior space is somewhat limited because of the heavy construction and foam, but nothing inside is in any danger of being damaged even if you're forced to check it in the jet way when the flight is too full. Highly recommend for any frequent flyer looking to protect sensitive electronics or any other delicate items.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderfully solid case. I have complete confidence in my tools and equipment being safe inside this case! The padded dividers are a little bit of a pain to orientate and I wish they were a little firmer because they allow gear to push them around. I also wish there was a way to have a center divider that didn't run the entire length of the case but at that rate they'd be filling the case with enough option dividers! Otherwise a great case. It has a slight resistance when opening that seems to go away halfway through so be careful not to push it over because you only need to pull hard when first opening it!
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Best case ever
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Lowepro protactic but I find this to be superior. I use this to store all my lens and cameras. It fits almost everything I use on a daily basis. Who needs a dry box when you have this. Plus, I can take this with me for shoots. It contains everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: snow0160

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Solid build. Im 6' 2" and i dont have a problem dragging this thing around, where others constantly hit my foot while im walking around because its too short. Tall people will understand. I havnt tested submurged under water and i dont plan to. With everything i put in it i have to stand on the lid to latch it closed. And when i do i feel like the lid bends and the seals dont close perfectly, but thats because i put a lot in this sucker. i feel completely safe with about $10,000 worth of equipment inside, as long as im not submurged under water.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to make fit specialized equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to shape the pre-scored foam to fit and the system of padded corrugated fluted plastic with clips even comes with a special cutter making strait cuts super easy. A great system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid case
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for recent trips, and just inside the carryon limit for all airlines I checked. One issue: The retractable handle is wide, shaped like a T, which prevents me from sliding another bag onto the case to wheel around. (Handle top is too wide). Seems like a design oversight, but of minor consequence.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this case. It is built to last a lifetime. The brochure states that it is watertight as long as the O ring is in good shape. I found no instructions on replacing the O ring included with the case. I hope I can find a "how to" video on you tube. I don't foresee a problem with durability though.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Durable and keepa items inside dries.
customer_reviews.text: Strong and durable. I have about 45lbs of tools in there and it gets tossed around by airport security and case still functions without any issues. It's scratched up but cosmeticly. Keeps my tools dry even in the bed of my pickup truck in the rain. Looking to pick another case from Pelican up for my camera gear. This case is great for camera gear since I tried it to see if this size works for me. I was able to fit my Canon 60D with 17-50f2.8, 70-200 F4, 40f2.8, 430EXII, cables, 3 sets of batteries, SD cards, cpuple of filters, flash bracket and wireless flash triggers. Tight fit but it all fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!
customer_reviews.text: Indestructible! I can load two pro bodies, telephoto, prime and specialty lenses along with batteries and so much other essential gear and not fear for the safety of my equipment. TSA has no problem with using it for carry on. I did buy TSA approved locks also. Sometimes you get separated from you overhead carry on ans I just want to make sure no one gets into my valuable gear. Only downside is it is heavy, so when loaded, you better eat you Wheaties as you can easily exceed 40lbs real quick, swing that overhead can be a challenge without hurting yourself or someone around you in an express like flight!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Never been disappointed with pelican products
customer_reviews.text: As with all pelican cases this one did not disappoint. It works very well for carry on fit in the overhead compartments very nicely. I would say consider getting the lid organizer if you are using it for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consider your use before deciding between pluck foam and compartments. Great case either way!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my camera gear and for the most part it's great. If I had to do it again though, I'd have gotten the one with the adjustable compartments (for my use). The case is solid and rolls well, the top locks with satisfying clicks and nothing feels cheap on it. I was able to get my d800 with 24-70, sony a7s with 70-200, 2 flash units and some remote triggers. I can easily see getting some more in if I could use the space better. The foam is very protective though. I also recommend the lid storage attachment. This is a great case either way, it's worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Love this case, in fact, I now use it daily instead of my backpack. Was dealing with pain in my neck and shoulders from carrying all my gear in my backpack, and this case solved the issues. Both bodies and two major lenses fit in the case easily and a separate purchase of the lid organizer put all the accessories in the case as well. Love the rigidity of the case and handle, rolls every easily, locks securely and tightly and is small enough to carry on airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  case and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Product A+ Seller A+ If you are considering buying... Do IT. I do a ton of travel. Flights, Trains, Bus, Ground, etc. In 1 year I went through 5 cheap and expensive luggage. Nothing could stand up to the airlines let alone any other travel. This case hasn't even shown signs of a little bit of travel. Since I have had it, it has had a healthy work. WORTH EVERY PENNY This case will actually save you money. Why? It lasts. I am replacing all my luggage with the Pelican line Seller - Perfect. Speedy shipping and very, very accommodating.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for camera system storage and transport.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent storage for a DSLR or mirrorless camera system. Enough space for two or three mirrorless bodies and four or five lenses as well as flash etc. Useful not only for travel (rollaboard) but also for at home storage of a camera system. Padded dividers are a bit more expensive than the pullout foam version but much faster to use and easier to reconfigure. Pull out foam version might be best for a very stable system but the padded dividers are more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Island Tractor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Well I got this case at an extreme discount due to Amazon honoring a price they posted by mistake. However, it is well worth the actual and real price. I use it a a tool box for work. I travel all over the USA and Canada driving one way and flying the other. Baggage handlers have damaged a couple bags so I decided to go big or go home. First trip out barely a scuff. It is perfect size and is lighter than it looks. Most of my co-workers and several friends in other fields use this case and claim you can't break it by accident. I am confident my tools are safe with Pelican.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Industry Standard for Quality Cases
customer_reviews.text: Finally took that next step, and I'm stoked I did! Pelican has been my go-to case for all my most important devices and electronics. This is a great case for keeping my camera equipment and lenses safe, especially when I travel! I just got it, so I don't know yet if I can carry-on an Airliner (but that's why I bought it so it better! Lol). Will know here soon though. Overall though, stoked! Arrived in the original Pelican box. Included: Case, Manual (and some other paperwork), and velcro organizers-pads for custom layout.
customer_reviews.author: SanDiego858

customer_reviews.title: Great hardshell case for traveling photographer/videographer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case! Especially if you are a traveling photographer/videographer. I currently carry the following items in this case. Canon C100MK2 Canon 6D 24-105 EF Lens 50mm 1.4 Lens 40mm 2.8 Pancake Lens 18-55mm EFS Lens 2 C100 Replacement batteries 3 6D Replacement batteries SD Card Case Attachement Mic for C100 Battery chargers for C100 and 6D C100 Handlew
customer_reviews.author: Steve Criminal

customer_reviews.title: Tank of a carry on - It weighs as much as one too
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. I travel a lot for work and wanted something that could be used as a carry on, but also could stand up to being checked as baggage for 60-80 flights a year. I trust that it will hold up to baggage handlers, rain, snow, and the normal wear and tear. This is a heavy suite case. It is roughly 30-50% heavier than a normal carry on. That said, I am happy with this purchase and intend to use this for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Stanton Evan Macintyre

customer_reviews.title: I also love that it has wheels so I don't have carry ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is everything I needed. It's small enough to travel with, but large enough to house a reasonable amount of gear. I also love that it has wheels so I don't have carry it everywhere. The pick and pluck can seem a little intimidating if you've never done it before, but if you plan out your gear layout first it's super easy. It makes me feel a lot better having my gear protected by such a sturdy case.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable, well-designed!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this case for two years now, I use it for pro camera gear. Very pleased with the quality. If I ever buy another one, will get one slightly bigger so as to carry additional video cam. Thanks Pelican.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Wyse

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing tolerances could be a bit better
customer_reviews.text: Pelican is the Cadillac of cases - in price and typically in quality. For this reason I was pretty surprised when I received this case. The handle is rather loose - when it is extended it wobbles forward and back, side to side, and up and down more than it should in my view and I am concerned that it could fail over time. The case itself is of expected high quality, but someone dropped the ball when they designed the handle mechanism. It feels like a cheap Chinese import to tell you the truth.
customer_reviews.author: DJ R

customer_reviews.title: Great case for flying
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a toolbox for when flying as I would not trust my tools in a soft sided bag or just any case this did great I went from Oklahoma To D.C. Still used it as my toolbox on the job site and back to Oklahoma and it's basicly just broke in and still has plenty of life and now serves as the case I keep my safty harness in
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Masters

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I travel for business and need to bring electornic equipment along. I used to use a traditional suitcase and wrap items in foam or cloth, and my equipment would not always work. After I switched to this case, everythign has been stable and workign well. Other people at customer sites and even co-workers are impressed with the goodness of this case. I highly recommend it and would buy again...in fact...i just ordered a second one to build a second setup for a co-worker.... love it! This is carry-on size and i prefer to carry-on my equipment versus checking it into the airlines to toss around.
customer_reviews.author: Godfather

customer_reviews.title: Love the wheels and the carry on size
customer_reviews.text: What a solid case! This thing takes a beating everywhere I go, but nothing inside does! used it to shlep around my DJI Phantom 2 plus GoPro plus many accessories and went all around the world with it. Big fan, would buy another one to carry my other camera gear. Love the wheels and the carry on size. Only one airline in Europe (Volotea) didn't allow me to take it as carry on without an extra fee.
customer_reviews.author: DGT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Solid Protection for Your Valuable and Sensitive Electronics Items
customer_reviews.text: Solid case. This case has been to Australia, Taiwan, Maldives, Hawaii, Cayman Islands, and Bonaire. It's a rugged case. The pick-and pluck foam works well for customizing the case. I'm on a second set of gear now, and need to replace the foam, as the layout needs to be reconfigured. The only negatives are that it's heavy and that the extendable handle takes up a lot of space. If you need to protect your fragile gear, and can handle the weight and the appearance (you're protecting something valuable here), then this is the case to get. Very popular among underwater photographers!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid case. Perfect for those who travel.
customer_reviews.text: great for travel. really ruggedly built. Glad I read everyone's reviews prior to purchasing this case. I have no regrets purchasing this case. After using it for 6 months or so, I wish it were just a bit deeper, but then it wouldn't meet FAA's stingy guidelines for carry-on luggage. And there's NO way I would trust the airport baggage handlers w/ my gear. Anyway, the size makes you really think about traveling with only what you'll realistically need on a typical shoot instead of packing (and lugging) more than you need to. It's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for weddings!
customer_reviews.text: Great case that I use for all my gear. I'm not even worried about my stuff getting rained on. I do wish I could upgrade my wheels to something more durable that I can roll over gravel, grass and etc...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Honcho

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: It fits in over head compartments great, it is the most durable case I've ever had, I can pack a lot of clothes in there because its is so ridged. Makes a nice seat when there are none in the departure lounge. Just took it on a trip to Montana and the planes were smaller than normal and they asked to put it in the belly in which must reside king Kong because the bag was thoroughly beaten and banged about. I lost no articles, my iPad was safe, and my little Sony HD Video Camera, and other than some surface scratches it is ready for the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Clopton

customer_reviews.title: Double check your measurements !
customer_reviews.text: A SUPER STRONG PROTECTIVE HOUSING ! The handle that slides out is black and looks out of place on this unit in my opinion , also it was too wide to slide through my pet carriers slot for that purpose . Inside measurements are quite less than other carry on units I've had . QUIK DELIVERY . UNCOMPARABLY STRONG HEAVY RESIN
customer_reviews.author: James Alward

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have few of these Pelican Cases with the padded dividers. I use them to store my cameras and lenses. This is perfect to store/carry a DSLR body with 70-200, 24-70, a prime or two and extra batteries. These are great to for traveling too since these are toughest and biggest FAA aproved airline-legal carry-on case. These are watertight, crushproof, and dust proof. You can also buy the pick-n-pluck foam instead of the padded divider however I would recommend the padded divider since the foam can be a hassle to use and might become bad after a few years. This case can last a lifetime and it comes with Pelican's Unconditional Lifetime Guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. The case is very solid, as are the double-snapping latches (which I secure with two Cargis TSA luggage locks). The case fits very comfortably in an overhead compartment (wheels in). On a recent trip, I packed a Vortex Razor HD 20-60x85 spotting scope in its case, Canon 7D Mark II body with a Sigma 10-20mm lens attached. Plus, a Sigma 150-600 telephoto, a 50 mm, and a 70-300 mm lens. Plus batteries, chargers, etc. Everything but the tripod. It was packed full, but secure. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sirach

customer_reviews.title: Pelican 1510-004-110 Case with Padded Dividers, Black
customer_reviews.text: Use this to hold all my camera equipment for weddings. Great case, built like a tank. Dividers work great at holding my camera gear in it's place with no worries of anything moving, the hoop and latch (velco) works great, it holds like no other. Double latching latch, have no issues knowing if it's fully latched, and even with arthritis I can open and close it easy enough, but it doesn't look like it would ever unlatch itself. I use the Pelican locks but seeing it's "Carry On" baggage size, it'll never be put into the hold of an airplane. Highly recommend this quality case with padded dividers.
customer_reviews.author: Kewlgrandpa

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this case
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this case! It fits everything I have very neatly. For the first time ever I have all my camera stuff in one case. The dividers make it easy to organize the case to your preference. It's extremely well built and sturdy. I wanted to get an FAA regulated size case due to my fear of checking my equipment. With this case, I'd dropped it from a second story building. It also comes with a great foam piece to help adsorb any impact inside the case. It rolls perfectly and smoothly. Easy to retract and release the handle. It's everything you'd expect from Pelican.
customer_reviews.author: nfordhk

customer_reviews.title: Don't Check this for airline travel
customer_reviews.text: First use on board domestic airlines, resulted in a broken buckle. this is my second Pelican case to suffer such an incident. I would recommend using TSA locks and heavy duty duct tape to cover the buckles, if you are checking this case. the bucklel design is the weak link on these cases. I am hopeful that this will be waranteed, as I only got one use out of this case.
customer_reviews.author: DavidD.Keen DDS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I use Pelican cases for all my photography gear. This was was used as a lighting kit and holds one strobe, two flashes, all my remote triggers, and spare batteries. The foam is a bit finicky to work with but its secure. This case has gone to hell and back and my gear is always safe. This particular model (1510) is also the maximum carry-on size. So if you're like me and you won't let your gear leave your side when you travel, you can rest easy knowing its safe.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: shop no more!
customer_reviews.text: I am a national heavy machinery traveling technician. I use this for ALL of my tools and parts. I am very happy with this product. And will likely never have to buy another one again. It's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: RedDog

customer_reviews.title: Fits almost everything
customer_reviews.text: I have this will ALL of my equipment in it. Including flash, 6 lenses chargers, cables and a Nikon D610 and Nikon D7000. I also have a point and shoot camera and a Samsung HD video recorder in it. I liked this version since it would mean that the cameras can sit in the case top to bottom and not left to right. This ensures that the camera does not slide down. The case is a beast and is very durable. I take this on the road with me and it fits where needed. Not worried about any of my gear. I also purchased the mesh that clips into the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Castro

customer_reviews.title: Safely Moved $1000s of electronics accross country.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transport 20 HDDs accross country... it survived a 2000+ mile trip with no harm to the contents. The pick N Puck foam seems nice at the onset but you have to be very careful while building your inserts, It squishes in odd ways and rips too much if you aren't paying attention. If I did it again i would consider getting the statis safe inserts for electronics. The case is smaller than it looks in the pictures, make sure to measure what you want to put in it before you buy it and get the case that is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Murphy

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: i needed a case for my traveling out of town for work. this is the case i been needing perfect for a weekend trip(without the foam inplace) or to take my expensive telecom/networking tools in( with foam in). this thing is tuff ,mobile airtight and waterproof . its really a no brainer if you want the best storage /transport system available. now they even have luggage . wow i want some !!! this is the first of many i hope to own ! dont hesitate get Pelican its pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sabatino

customer_reviews.title: Great size for checked luggage.
customer_reviews.text: I use this case as my primary field toolbox when I chase helicopters during the fire season. The padded dividers help to keep tools segregated and when you pair this with the lid organizer it's simply spectacular for carrying essential tools and consumables. This size case is big enough to hold a generous supply of tools and still meet the weight limit of airlines for checked luggage plus its still compact enough to not be unwieldy. Only flaw I can see is the small wheel size which doesn't work so well on surfaces other than asphalt and concrete. Hates gravel, mud, soft dirt, tall grass, etc.
customer_reviews.author: HeloFxr84

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE FOR TRAVELING PHOTOG/VIDEOGRAPHERS
customer_reviews.text: seriously one of the greatest investments - of all the gear I have, this case proves to be the most versatile and travels amazingly well - the wheels have been through the ringer and years later are still rolling strong. I also bought the top lid organizer - a must have in concert with this case - never given trouble by TSA, fits in all overhead bins precisely - have been through 3 different camera setups with it and I really love the versatility - idk give it more than 5 stars if i could!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Y

customer_reviews.title: Excellent durable carry-on
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and live out of my carry-on. After breaking my last 2 carry-ons I figured I'd spend a bit more and get this. It's heavy but I'm confident my grand-kids will someday inherit this case.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: It's as amazing as you hear it is
customer_reviews.text: Simply stated, you don't have to worry about what you put in this case. Raining outside, no problem. Need to stand on something to get a higher vantage point, no problem. Need something to sit on, sit on the 1510. Where cameras and lenses come and go, this case remains as something that can always be counted on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Item Not as Described in Title or Description
customer_reviews.text: Product description indicated that it comes with black dividers, but it actually comes with yellow dividers. I wanted the cases to match my other cases with black dividers. Guess I would suggest that a buyers shouldn't rely on the Title or the Description when purchasing this product. Rather you should rely on the pictures. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug D.

product_meta.title: Pelican 1510 Case With Foam (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:With Foam| Pattern Name:CaseWaterproof crush-proof and dust-proof Convoluted lid foam FAA maximum carry-on size Retractable extension handle Strong polyurethane wheels with stainless steel bearings Easy open double throw latches Open cell core with solid wall design - strong lightweight-ring seal Automatic pressure equalization valve Stainless steel hardware and padlock protectors Comfortable rubber over-molded handle Lifetime guarantee of excellence Interior: 19 3/4" W x 11" H x 7 5/8" D
feature_bullets: Watertight, Crush-Proof and dust-proof. Lid depth:  1.79" (4.5 cm); bottom depth: 5.79" (14.7 cm); total depth: 7.58" (19.3 cm)
Faa maximum carry on size and buoyancy is 64.15 pounds
Open cell core with solid wall design to make a strong yet lightweight travel case
Easy open double throw latches cover, O-Ring seal and a automatic pressure equalization valve.

Lifetime guarantee of excellence. Interior (L x w x d): 19.75" X 11.00" X 7.60" (50.2 x 27.9 x 19.3 Exterior (L x w x d): 22.00" X 13.81" X 9.00" (55.9 x 35.1 x 22.9 cm).PURGE VENT: 3 Micron Hydrophobic Non-Woven
MINIMUM TEMPERATURE: -40° F (-40 ° C); MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE: 210° F (99 ° C)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,239 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
